# Prep

```{r}

response <- read_csv('./data/final_model_inputs/events_inputs_v2.csv') %>%
  select(site,
         sp_cat, # categorical
         fire, # categorical
         stage_rise_cm,
         lag2peak_halfP,
         lag2peak_Pstart,
         MI60_mmhr,
         lag_pwd,
         terrain_hypso75 = hypso75,
         terrain_hypso25 = hypso25,
         terrain_hypso50 = hypso50,
         terrain_connec = IC,
         terrain_conn_dnbr = hydraulic_func_conn,
         area_km2 = area_km2.x,
         terrain_rc_circle = RC_CIRCLE.x,
         terrain_slope40 = slope40_frac,
         soil_brockdepmin = brockdepmin,
         terrain_recharge = frac_recharge_area,
         #terrain_vbw = avg_vbw_m,
         soil_sand = AVG_SAND,
         mean_dnbr, 
         soil_clay = AVG_CLAY,
         soil_ksat = AVG_KSAT, 
         terrain_elongation = ELONGATION.x, 
         soil_availwaterstor = aws0150wta, 
         NDVI, 
         terrain_vall_holl = frac_valley,
         terrain_flowlength = flow_length_m, 
         terrain_slope30 = slope30_frac, 
         SP_mean,
         terrain_hypsoint = hypso_integral,
         year,
         terrain_glacial = frac_glacial,
         fire_no,
         mulch_frac) %>%
  mutate(site_number = as.integer(factor(site))) %>% # give each site a number
  select(-site)

```

# Correlations

```{r}

# make a df that is just one row per site
site_vars <- response %>%
  distinct(site_number, .keep_all = T)

# columns to plot for distr.
cols_to_plot <- c(3:34)

plots <- map(cols_to_plot, ~ {
  col_name <- names(site_vars)[.x]
  
  ggplot(site_vars, aes(x = .data[[col_name]])) +
    geom_density(fill = "steelblue", alpha = 0.6) +
    theme_bw(base_size=20)
})

# Print the plots
walk(plots, print)
# distr. are funky so use spearman


corr_prep <- site_vars %>%
  select(-c(#MI60_mmhr,
            #lag_pwd,
            lag2peak_halfP,
            lag2peak_Pstart,
            #stage_rise_cm,
            fire_no)) %>%
  select(where(is.numeric))

corr_matrix <- cor(corr_prep, 
                   use = "complete.obs",
                   method = 'spearman')

ggcorrplot(corr_matrix, method = "square", 
           hc.order = FALSE,
           #type = "lower", 
           lab = TRUE, 
           lab_col = "black", 
           lab_size = 3,
           colors = brewer.pal(n = 3, name = "BrBG")) +
  theme(
    axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, hjust = 1),
    axis.text.y = element_text(hjust = 1))

ggsave(
  './figures/SR_response/corrplot_all.png',
       dpi=600,
       width=14,
       height=12)

# filter to only view values > abs(0.6)
masked_corr <- corr_matrix %>%
  as.data.frame() %>%
  mutate(across(everything(), 
                ~ ifelse(abs(.) <= 0.6, 
                         NA, .)))

ggcorrplot(masked_corr, method = "square", 
           #hc.order = FALSE,
           type = "lower", 
           lab = TRUE, 
           lab_col = "black", 
           lab_size = 3, 
           colors = brewer.pal(n = 3, name = "BrBG")) +
  theme(
    axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, hjust = 1),
    axis.text.y = element_text(hjust = 1))

ggsave(
  './figures/SR_response/corrplot_cross.png',
       dpi=600,
       width=14,
       height=12)

```

# RF modeling

```{r}

data <- response %>%
  #filter(fire == 'etf') %>%
  #filter(sp_cat == 'low') %>%
  drop_na()

rf_all <- randomForest(stage_rise_cm ~ 
                      MI60_mmhr + 
                      lag_pwd +
                      SP_mean +
                      terrain_glacial +
                      terrain_vall_holl +
                      soil_clay +
                      mean_dnbr +
                      NDVI +
                      terrain_slope30 +
                      terrain_hypso75 +
                      terrain_connec +
                      terrain_elongation +
                      terrain_flowlength +
                      soil_ksat +
                      terrain_recharge +
                      #mulch_frac +
                      year,
                    data = data, 
                    mtry = 6, 
                    ntree = 500)

# variable importance
varImpPlot(rf_all)

varImps <- rf_all$importance %>%
  as.data.frame() 

sr_all_RF <- varImps %>%
  mutate(., normINP = IncNodePurity/max(IncNodePurity)) %>%
  rownames_to_column('Predictor') %>%
  mutate(Predictor = as.factor(Predictor)) %>%
  ggplot(aes(x=reorder(Predictor, normINP), y=normINP)) + theme_bw(base_size = 20) +
      geom_bar(stat='identity', color='black', fill='black') +
      coord_flip() +
      labs(y='Normalized Variable Importance') +
      theme(axis.title.y = element_blank()) +
  theme(legend.position="bottom",
        text = element_text(size=20)) +
  ggtitle('Stage rise - All, n = 240')

sr_all_RF

ggsave(
  "./figures/SR_response/RF_SR_all.png",
  width=12,
  height=8,
  dpi = 600
)

```

# GAM PD plots

```{r}
data <- response %>%
  #filter(fire == 'etf') %>%
  #filter(sp_cat == 'low') %>%
  drop_na()

# vars used in PD plots
vars <- c(#'lag_pwd',
          'SP_mean',
          'terrain_glacial',
          'terrain_vall_holl',
          'soil_clay',
          'mean_dnbr',
          #'NDVI',
          'terrain_slope30',
          'terrain_hypso75',
          'terrain_connec',
          'terrain_elongation',
          'terrain_flowlength',
          'soil_ksat',
          'terrain_recharge',
          'year')

# test significance for interactions - one a time
gam <- gam(stage_rise_cm ~ 
             s(MI60_mmhr) +
             s(site_number, bs = "re") +
             s(MI60_mmhr, site_number, bs = "fs") +
             s(MI60_mmhr, by=soil_clay),  # update the terrain var here
            family = Gamma(link = "log"),
            data = data)

summary(gam)
AIC(gam)


plot(gam)

plot(gam, select = 4, rug = TRUE, shade = TRUE)

##
library(gratia)
```

# Plot interaction 

```{r}

library(gratia)
library(ggplot2)

# Generate prediction data across MI60 range for several soil_clay levels
newdat <- with(data, expand.grid(
  MI60_mmhr = seq(min(MI60_mmhr), max(MI60_mmhr), length.out = 100),
  soil_clay = quantile(soil_clay, probs = c(0.1, 0.5, 0.9)),
  site_number = levels(factor(site_number))[1]  # hold site constant
))


# Predict on response scale
newdat$fit <- predict(gam, newdata = newdat, type = "response")

ggplot(newdat, aes(x = MI60_mmhr, y = fit, color = factor(soil_clay))) +
  geom_line(size = 1) +
  labs(x = "MI60 (mm/hr)", y = "Predicted Stage Rise (cm)", color = "Soil Clay") +
  theme_minimal()

```

```{r}
#   error = function(e) {
#     # Return NA for model error - usually for year (not enough values for 5 knots)
#     tibble(variable = var, 
#            p_value = NA_real_)
#   })
# })

pval_table <- map_dfr(vars, function(var) {
  tryCatch({
    # Updated formula with terrain_glacial replaced by var
    form <- as.formula(paste0(
      "stage_rise_cm ~ ",
      "s(MI60_mmhr) + ",
      "s(MI60_mmhr, site_number, bs = 'fs') + ",
      "s(site_number, bs = 're') + ",
      "s(MI60_mmhr, by = ", var, ")"
    ))
    
    # Fit GAM
    mod <- gam(form, 
               family = Gamma(link = "log"), 
               data = data)
    
    # Extract p-value for interaction term
    sum_mod <- summary(mod)
    term_label <- paste0("s(MI60_mmhr):", var)
    pval <- sum_mod$s.table[term_label, "p-value"]
    
    tibble(variable = var, 
           p_value = pval)
    
  }, 
  error = function(e) {
    tibble(variable = var, 
           p_value = NA_real_)
  })
})

pval_table <- pval_table %>%
  mutate(pval_adjusted = p_value/13, # use 13 since ndvi and pwd aren't included in this
         sig = if_else(p_value < 0.0038, # =0.05/13
                       'sig', 
                       'ns'))

all <- pval_table %>%
  mutate(cat = 'all')

```

# Archive

```{r}

# compare response shapes RF versus GAM
part1 <- partial(rf_all, pred.var = c('MI60_mmhr')) 
plotPartial(part1, rug = T, train = data)

# no random effects
gam1 <- gam(stage_rise_cm ~ 
              s(MI60_mmhr),
            family = Gamma(link = "log"),
            data = data)

summary(gam1)
plot(gam1)
AIC(gam1)

# add random effect to GAM
gamm_site <- gamm(stage_rise_cm ~ s(MI60_mmhr), 
                  random = list(site_number = ~1),
                  family = Gamma(link = "log"),
                  data = data)

plot(gamm_site$gam)

AIC(gamm_site$lme) # AIC much lower w/ site number as random effect

summary(gamm_site$gam)  # fixed effects
summary(gamm_site$lme)  # random effects

# interactions
part2 <- partial(rf_all, pred.var = c('MI60_mmhr', 'lag_pwd')) 
plotPartial(part2, rug = T, train = data)

gam2 <- gamm(stage_rise_cm ~ 
               s(MI60_mmhr, by = lag_pwd),
             random = list(site_number = ~1),
             family = Gamma(link = "log"),
             data = data)


summary(gam2$gam)
plot(gam2$gam)

```
